column4: I can't seem to find liblua51 and liblualib51, but only the (relatively ancient) 50 versions (from 2003, it seems). will I have to download these manually? if so, how do I install them without making the package manager confused?
i find a lot of liblua5.1-* packages
no the results of the bot are trash ;P do "apt-cache search lua5.1" on your ubuntu box
oh, I find lua5.1, that's not the problem
a lot more just run the command i gave
the only lua.h I can find, though, is in /usr/include/lua50/lua.h
misieq: thank you, my lua problems seems to be gone (though having to specify 5.1 all the time is a bit irritating)
thank you, running it now. I'll see what happens
hm, that produces some messages about unknown media types. they don't seem to be fatal though. is it normal?
can not tell without seeing the actual mesgs but if the configure run until completion it may be harmless
I see. In that case, I will install a new firefox manually, and enable the proper branding myself
